compose.isolation.cardDescription: Configure isolated deployment to the compose file.
compose.isolation.description: This feature creates an isolated environment for your deployment by adding unique prefixes to all resources. It establishes a dedicated network based on your compose file's name, ensuring your services run in isolation. This prevents conflicts when running multiple instances of the same template or services with identical names.
compose.isolation.enableDescription: Enable isolated deployment to the compose file.
compose.isolation.previewDialogDescripti: Preview of the compose file with isolated deployment configuration
compose.randomize.dialogDescription: Use this in case you want to deploy the same compose file and you have conflicts with some property like volumes, networks, etc.
compose.randomize.description: This will randomize the compose file and will add a suffix to the property to avoid conflicts
compose.randomize.envInfo: When you activate this option, we will include a env `COMPOSE_PREFIX` variable to the compose file so you can use it in your compose file.
compose.randomize.applyDescription: Apply randomize to the compose file.

database.externalCredentials.title: External Credentials

application.preview.dialog.title: Preview Deployment Settings
application.preview.dialog.description: Adjust the settings for preview deployments of this application, including environment variables, build options, and deployment rules.
application.preview.field.path.label: Preview Path
application.preview.field.port.label: Port
application.preview.field.labels.label: Preview Labels
application.preview.field.labels.tooltip: Optional labels to identify or filter preview deployments (for example, feature, staging, QA). Press Enter to add each label.
application.preview.field.labels.inputPl: Enter a label and press Enter
application.preview.field.limit.label: Preview Deployments Limit
application.preview.field.limit.placehol: Maximum number of preview deployments to keep (e.g. 3)
application.preview.field.https.label: Enable HTTPS
application.preview.field.https.descript: Enable HTTPS for preview deployments. When enabled, you can choose how certificates are managed.
application.preview.field.enabled.label: Enable preview deployments
application.preview.field.enabled.descri: Turn preview deployments on or off for this application.
application.preview.field.requirePermiss: Require collaborators to have sufficient permissions to access preview deployments. Valid roles are:
application.preview.validation.customCer: Custom certificate resolver is required when using the Custom certificate provider.
redirects.card.title: Redirects
redirects.card.description: If you want to redirect requests to this application, use the following config to set up the redirects.
redirects.dialog.title: Redirects
redirects.dialog.description: Redirects are used to redirect requests to another URL.
redirects.form.permanentDescription: Set the permanent option to true to apply a permanent redirection.
redirects.dialog.delete.title: Delete Redirect
redirects.dialog.delete.description: Are you sure you want to delete this redirect?
ports.dialog.title: Ports
ports.dialog.description: Uygulamanızı internete açmak için portlar kullanılır.
ports.form.publishModePlaceholder: Select a publish mode for the port
ports.alert.hostModeBody: When using Host publish mode, Docker Swarm has limitations that prevent proper container updates during deployments. Old containers may not be replaced automatically. Consider using Ingress mode instead, or be prepared to manually stop/start the application after deployments.
ports.card.title: Ports
ports.card.description: Configure the ports that expose your application to the internet.
ports.alert.redeployReminder: Please remember to click Redeploy after adding, editing, or deleting ports to apply the changes.
ports.dialog.delete.title: Delete Port
ports.dialog.delete.description: Are you sure you want to delete this port?
resources.card.title: Resources
resources.card.description: Increase or decrease the allocated resources for a specific application or database.
resources.alert.redeployReminder: Please remember to click Redeploy after modifying the resources to apply the changes.
resources.tooltip.memoryLimit: Memory hard limit in bytes. Example: 1GB = 1073741824 bytes.
resources.tooltip.memoryReservation: Memory soft limit in bytes. Example: 256MB = 268435456 bytes.
resources.tooltip.cpuLimit: CPU quota in units of 10^-9 CPUs. Example: 2 CPUs = 2000000000.
importTemplate.card.title: Import
importTemplate.card.description: Import your template configuration from a Base64-encoded payload.
importTemplate.alert.importWarning: Warning: Importing a template will remove all existing environment variables, mounts, and domains from this service.
importTemplate.dialog.previewDescription: Review the template information before importing.
buildServer.card.title: Build Server
buildServer.card.description: Configure a dedicated server for building your application.
buildServer.alert.description: Build servers offload the build process from your deployment servers. Select a build server and registry to use for building your application.
buildServer.alert.noRegistry.prefix: You need to add at least one registry to use build servers. Please go to
buildServer.form.serverDescription: Select a build server to handle the build process for this application.
buildServer.form.registryDescription: Select a registry to store the built images from the build server.
application.git.watchPathsPlaceholder: Enter a path to watch (e.g., src/**, dist/*.js)
application.git.watchPathsTooltip: Add paths to watch for changes. When files in these paths change, a new deployment will be triggered. This will work only when a manual webhook is set up.
application.git.github.empty.description: To deploy using GitHub, you need to configure your account first.
application.git.gitlab.empty.description: To deploy using GitLab, you need to configure your account first.
application.git.bitbucket.form.watchPath: Add paths to watch for changes. When files in these paths change, a new deployment will be triggered.
Enter a path to watch (e.g., src/**, dist/*.js)
application.git.gitea.form.watchPathsToo: Add paths to watch for changes. When files in these paths change, a new deployment will be triggered.
application.git.gitea.form.watchPathsPla: Enter a path to watch (e.g., src/**, dist/*.js)
application.git.main.cardDescription: Select the source of your code
application.git.gitea.empty.description: To deploy using Gitea, you need to configure your account first.
application.git.bitbucket.empty.descript: To deploy using Bitbucket, you need to configure your account first.
application.git.unauthorized.alertDescri: This application is connected to a {{provider}} repository through a git provider that you don't have access to. You can see basic repository information below, but cannot modify the configuration.
Are you sure you want to disconnect this repository?
Disconnecting will allow you to configure a new repository with your own git providers.
